intro.text: It seems odd that the man is wearing sun glasses in the dark basement.

response.text: The name's Romanoff. You might have heard people referring to me as "The Priest". They are damn right I'm a priest! Honor graduate from Leningrad Theological Academy in 1954 and I've been a priest until 1978.

Well, I was naiive. Even at the age of 56. When I learned about the Visitations, the ghouls and the serums, I thought the End was coming. I wanted to come here and get a glimpse of the Revelation. But I was wrong - it was just another chapter of humanity, of greed and bloodthirst.

option.title: Basement
option.text: So what are you doing here in the basement?

response.text: In the past few years I've been working on serum recipes, hoping to find something that can help the sick - that's the least I can do. I used myself as guinea pig. Last year I made a mistake and poisoned myself. My eyes slowly gave in, and I set up this safe house before I was completely blind.

option.title: Blind
option.text: How did you manage to live here while blinded?

response.text: I have a friend who's been helping me, trading supplies for my serum. But he hasn't showed up for two weeks and my supply is low. So perhaps... you could help me out?
Thank you for dealing with the wolves outside! They've been bothering me for a while.

option.title: Garage Door
option.text: Do you have the key to the garage? I was sent here to investigate the Mad Mechanic anomaly.

response.text: Did Sidorovich send you here? I knew it! That greedy bastard. Be careful when you work for him - he only cares about his money and wouldn't blink an eye while watching you get torn up by anomalies. What does he want exactly?

option.title: Restore
option.text: He gave me a rifle to restore its condition.

response.text: I see. Here's the key. The Mad Mechanic is not very forgiving. One wrong move and your rifle is gone. Experiment with it a bit with some pistols and try to figure out the pattern.
